      • getNativeLocalPath

        public static java.lang.String getNativeLocalPath()
        Absolute Path to native libraries required by Knowledge-Agents. NOTE: usually "user.dir" plus ./lib/.

      • getNativeRelativePath

        public static java.lang.String getNativeRelativePath()
        Solution adopted has been: the double path for locating natural Java and native libraries C++ for Java.

        The first is a hard-code to ./lib/name-of-architecture. It permits to make a Developer's Environment and it take its data from getNativeLibPath().

        The second solutions is made from NativeRelativePath() plus addNativeLibraryPath() amplification. This solution is for deployment at big scale inside servers. It requires make the new variable (sFrameworkAppNativeLib) in framework.properties ("ps.framework.app.nativelib") and uses it for make a new Paths to Operating System. Relative or absolute. Its mission is for Systems Administrators and for setup a centralization model of libraries of JADE, Jess, BeanShell and CLIPS, plus the gateway of JNI CLIPSJNI.xxx library for each architecture.

        Returns:
        Absolute position of native libraries.

        Parameters:

      • extractFromFirst

        private static void extractFromFirst(java.nio.file.FileSystem fs,
                    java.lang.String path,
                    java.lang.String target,
                    boolean isNdoOpt)
                              throws java.lang.Throwable
        This is an extension of ZipJava ORACLE. With an one more parameter it is possible to take decision about final location of files inside that JAR.
        Parameters:
        fs - The file system from extract.
        path - The path from getting files.
        target - The final point where data is saved like file.
        isNdoOpt - making new PsNode.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - Error caption.

      • mkdirs

        private static void mkdirs(java.nio.file.Path path)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        It is used by extractFromFirst Function.

        Parameters:
        path - Position where files will be copied.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When to make a new directory was not possible.

      • addNativeLibraryPath

        public static void addNativeLibraryPath()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        This function enables the java.library.path to be modified at runtime.

        Sun Engineers + Filter of Local (dps.library.path). http://forums.sun.com/thread.jspa?threadID=707176

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Method for capturing an error situation.

      • addDir

        private static void addDir(java.io.File dirObj,
          java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream out)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Making a zip file of directory including its sub-directories recursively. Source: http://www.java2s.com/Code/Java/File-Input-Output/Makingazipfileofdirectoryincludingitssubdirectoriesrecursively.htm NOTE: Modificado para extraer solo Path relativo al Framework.
        Parameters:
        dirObj - The directory to compress.
        out - The ZipOutputStream where zip files will be created.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When something about compress made crash..

      • generateNewPsNode

        public static void generateNewPsNode(java.lang.String nameOfNewPsNode,
                     java.lang.String typeOfPsNode)
                              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Make an structure of directories and add it to DPS-Framework nodes directory.

        NOTE: from October versions, this functions only inside Development-Agent Environment, that is, not when applications are running on big scale mode with centralized libraries.

        Parameters:
        nameOfNewPsNode - Name of new node.
        typeOfPsNode - Select kind of node
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - Method for capturing errors situations.
